message:
I guess it requires access to kernel of Windows and Microsoft doesn't allow it. I wanted to see code of methods in `kernel32.dll`, but it's not public.
If u think it's possible, can u provide some idea/concept, how would u start to write unmanaged dll like that? Do u have idea, how body of this exemplary method looks?
https://www.pinvoke.net/default.aspx/kernel32/WriteFile.html
I'm just curious that if u want to gain this knowledge, is it necessary to work in Microsoft or is it necessary to look into open source Linux kernel for better understanding of topic.
